modules.description: This module represents pixel data in a single packed array format, using unsigned 8-bit bigarrays. It provides structured access to image planes through a data type that includes buffer size, stride information, and vector kind for optimized memory layout. It is used when handling raw image buffers for efficient pixel manipulation during scaling or format conversion.

This module provides functions to create a scaling context and perform image resizing and pixel format conversion between specified input and output video data types. It works with video data structures defined by the `I` and `O` modules, handling operations like scaling dimensions and converting color spaces. Concrete use cases include resizing video frames for display or encoding, and converting raw video data from one pixel format to another during processing pipelines.

This module operates on byte arrays representing pixel data, providing functions to scale images and convert between color spaces or pixel formats. It works directly with the `t` type, which pairs string buffers and integer strides to represent image planes. Concrete use cases include resizing video frames and converting raw image data from one format (e.g., YUV) to another (e.g., RGB) for display or processing.

This module represents video frames and provides operations for creating, manipulating, and accessing frame data. It works with pixel data in various color formats and supports operations like setting pixel values, retrieving frame dimensions, and managing frame buffers. Concrete use cases include preparing video frames for scaling, converting between pixel formats, and extracting frame metadata for processing pipelines.

This module represents image data as a big array of unsigned 8-bit integers, organized into separate planes for each color channel. It provides direct access to pixel data through standard Bigarray operations, enabling efficient manipulation of multi-planar image buffers. It is used when handling pixel formats that store color channels in distinct memory regions, such as YUV formats with planar layouts.

Performs image scaling and pixel format conversion with support for planar and packed pixel layouts. It operates on video frames using data structures like `planes`, `BigArray`, and `Bytes` to handle multi-format image buffers. Used to resize video frames and convert between formats like YUV and RGB during video processing pipelines.
